website_summaries.verdict: A budget-priced Les Paul from a Gibson subsidiary (Epiphone) that is strikingly similar to the original. You won't find a better guitar at this price.
pros: The sound of a Les Paul at a budget price
cons: Light and bendy" strings not ideal for all styles (but they can be replaced)

customer_reviews.title: Favorite guitar!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar 5 months ago, and I have I say I am very pleased. For the money you can't go wrong. This is my second electric guitar, first one being a Fender Stratocaster. And I find myself playing my Epiphone more often. I've played many electrics and I love the feel, Look and sound of this guitar. I put brand new super slinky nickel wound string on it right when I got it. Highly recommend it. Don't but a les Paul standard unless you have the money. I put cream white pick guard, new knobs, switch washer, hum bucker covers, and fret decals. It looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Holes in the headstock were stripped
customer_reviews.text: When I got the guitar I noticed a rattling sound. The action looked okay, so I decided to troubleshoot it and see where the noise was coming from. Turns out that two of the tuning pegs were rattling because the screws weren't holding them firmly down onto the guitar. I tried tightening the screws but they just swiveled around and wouldn't tighten anymore. The actual holes in the guitar that the screws go into were stripped on those two pegs, and that's why the screws wouldn't stay tightened. I tried swapping around different screws since the other pegs were secure, but it wasn't the screws, it was the holes on the two faulty pegs.

product_meta.title: Epiphone Les Paul Special II Electric Guitar (Vintage Sunburst)
product_meta.description: What's so special about the Epiphone Les Paul Special II Electric Guitar? The super-low price for starters and that's not all. It gives you all the essential elements of a Les Paul. Made with a mahogany body, bolt-on mahogany neck, smooth 22-fret rosewood fingerboard, this baby is every bit as handsome as its uptown cousins. Features 700T/650R open-coil humbucking pickups that deliver long, singing sustain and true Les Paul tones. The LockTone Tune-O-Matic bridge and stopbar tailpiece add more sustain and make string changing easier. Limited lifetime warranty. Strings: D'Addario; 10, 13, 17, 26, 36, 46
